Foscarnet selectively inhibits pyrophosphate binding on viral DNA polymerases, thus suppressing HSV-1, HSV-2, and CMV replication. It is also active against VZV, HHV-6, and EBV.
59 Unlike ganciclovir, foscarnet does not require intracellular conversion to active triphosphate, thus maintaining activity against herpesviruses with TK or UL97 kinase mutations.
